intro: Racosperma nematophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed wattle, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its slender, zigzagging stems and small, bipinnate leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in dense, cylindrical clusters, which are typical of the genus Racosperma. It is a woody shrub that thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in coastal or inland regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and restoration projects.
